Question: What is the name of your CI/CD infrastructure project?
Guidance: Provide internal project reference name

Question: Who is the primary stakeholder for this DevOps infrastructure project?
Guidance: Name, role, and decision-making authority (typically VP Engineering or DevOps lead)
Notes: Main point of contact and decision authority

Question: What CI/CD challenges are you trying to solve with on-premises infrastructure?
Guidance: Common challenges: High cloud CI/CD costs (GitHub Actions, CircleCI), Slow build queue times, Data sovereignty for source code, Limited build agent capacity, Vendor lock-in concerns
Notes: Primary business driver for on-prem CI/CD investment

Question: What is your current CI/CD platform and infrastructure?
Guidance: Describe: Cloud CI/CD (GitHub Actions, GitLab.com, CircleCI), Self-hosted (Jenkins, GitLab), Build agent types, Pain points

Question: How many developers need CI/CD build and deployment capabilities?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 10-25 developers, 26-50 developers, 51-100 developers, 100+ developers
Notes: Determines build agent quantity and scale

Question: What is your average daily build volume?
Guidance: Common ranges: 100-500 builds/day, 500-2000 builds/day, 2000-5000 builds/day, 5000+ builds/day
Notes: Workload sizing for build farm capacity

Question: What are your primary goals for deploying on-premises CI/CD infrastructure?
Guidance: Common goals: Reduce cloud costs, Improve build performance, Enable air-gapped builds, Data sovereignty, Consistent build times, Artifact management control

Question: How will you measure CI/CD infrastructure deployment success?
Guidance: Define KPIs: Build queue time <5 min, Cloud cost savings %, Build success rate 95%+, Artifact download speed, Developer NPS score

Question: What is your expected timeline for CI/CD infrastructure deployment?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 0-4 weeks pilot, 1-3 months phased migration, 3-6 months full cutover
Notes: Project timeline expectations and migration constraints

Question: What is your approved budget range for CI/CD infrastructure?
Guidance: Common ranges: $200K-$500K, $500K-$1M, $1M-$2M, $2M+. Include both CapEx (servers) and OpEx (licenses)

Question: What is your long-term vision for DevOps infrastructure?
Guidance: Consider: Expansion to more teams, Multi-cloud CI/CD, Enterprise artifact repository, Security scanning integration, ML model training pipelines

Question: How do you expect developer count and build volume to change over 3 years?
Guidance: Provide current developer count and projected annual growth rate (10%, 25%, 50%)

Question: What CI/CD platform are you currently using?
Guidance: Common platforms: GitHub Actions, GitLab.com, GitLab self-hosted, Jenkins, CircleCI, Azure DevOps, Bitbucket Pipelines

Question: What CI/CD platform do you prefer for on-premises deployment?
Guidance: Options: GitLab Premium self-hosted, GitLab Ultimate, Jenkins (open-source), Azure DevOps Server, Bitbucket Data Center

Question: What source control system do you use?
Guidance: Options: GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, Azure DevOps Repos, Self-hosted Git

Question: What programming languages and build types do you support?
Guidance: Common: Node.js/npm, Java/Maven/Gradle, Python, Go, .NET/C#, Docker images, Mobile (iOS/Android)
Notes: Build agent configuration and tooling requirements

Question: What is your average build duration?
Guidance: Typical: 5-10 minutes (microservices), 10-30 minutes (standard apps), 30-60 minutes (monoliths), 60+ minutes (complex builds)

Question: How many concurrent builds do you need to support?
Guidance: Calculate: developer count × average commits/day ÷ work hours. Example: 50 devs × 4 commits ÷ 8 hours = 25 concurrent builds

Question: What build agent operating systems are required?
Guidance: Options: Linux (Ubuntu, RHEL), Windows Server, macOS (iOS builds), Docker containers

Question: Do you need artifact repository and package management?
Guidance: Options: JFrog Artifactory, Sonatype Nexus, GitLab Package Registry, Azure Artifacts, No centralized repository

Question: What artifact types need to be stored and managed?
Guidance: Artifact types: Maven/JAR, npm packages, Docker images, Python wheels, NuGet packages, Generic binaries
Notes: Artifact storage capacity and format support

Question: What is your estimated artifact storage capacity requirement?
Guidance: Ranges: 1-5TB (small), 5-20TB (medium), 20-50TB (large), 50TB+ (enterprise)
Notes: Storage capacity sizing for Unity or PowerScale

Question: Do you need code quality and security scanning integration?
Guidance: Options: SonarQube, SonarCloud, Checkmarx, Veracode, Snyk, GitHub Advanced Security, No scanning required

Question: Do you use Docker or containerized build workflows?
Guidance: Container usage: No containers, Docker builds only, Docker + Kubernetes deployment, Full container-native CI/CD

Question: What secrets management solution do you use?
Guidance: Options: HashiCorp Vault, Azure Key Vault, AWS Secrets Manager, CyberArk, GitLab CI/CD variables, None (plaintext)

Question: What compute capacity is required per build agent?
Guidance: Agent specs: 4 CPU/8GB RAM (light), 8 CPU/16GB RAM (standard), 16 CPU/32GB RAM (heavy), 32+ CPU/64GB RAM (intensive)

Question: Do you need parallel build execution or distributed builds?
Guidance: Parallelism: Sequential builds only, Parallel test execution, Distributed compilation (Bazel, ccache), Matrix builds

Question: What deployment targets must CI/CD pipelines support?
Guidance: Targets: Kubernetes, Docker Swarm, VMs, Cloud (AWS/Azure/GCP), On-prem servers, Mobile app stores

Question: How complex are your CI/CD pipelines?
Guidance: Complexity: Simple build+test, Multi-stage (build/test/deploy), Approval gates, Blue-green deployments, Canary releases

Question: What testing frameworks and tools do pipelines execute?
Guidance: Testing: Unit tests only, Integration tests, E2E tests, Performance tests, Security tests, Load tests
Notes: Test execution duration and resource requirements

Question: Do you need build caching and dependency proxying?
Guidance: Caching: No caching, Docker layer caching, Maven/npm proxy cache, Distributed build cache (Gradle, Bazel)

Question: What notification and collaboration integrations are required?
Guidance: Integrations: Slack, Microsoft Teams, Email, Jira, PagerDuty, Webhooks

Question: What is the sensitivity level of source code and builds?
Guidance: Levels: Open source (public), Internal (proprietary), Confidential (trade secrets), Regulated (ITAR, FedRAMP)

Question: What compliance standards must CI/CD infrastructure meet?
Guidance: Common standards: SOC 2, ISO 27001, PCI DSS, HIPAA, FedRAMP, NIST 800-53, CMMC

Question: Do you require air-gapped or disconnected build environments?
Guidance: Air-gap requirements: Internet-connected, Proxy/firewall only, Fully air-gapped, Classified network

Question: What role-based access control is required for CI/CD platform?
Guidance: RBAC: Basic (developer, admin), Project-based, Branch protection, Environment-based approvals, SOD (separation of duties)

Question: What authentication and SSO requirements apply?
Guidance: Options: Local accounts, Active Directory/LDAP, SAML SSO, OIDC, MFA required, Certificate-based

Question: What audit and compliance logging is required?
Guidance: Requirements: Build logs, User access audit, Pipeline execution history, Artifact download tracking, Retention period (1 year, 3 years, 7 years)
Notes: Audit trail and compliance reporting needs

Question: Do pipelines require security vulnerability scanning?
Guidance: Scanning: Container image scanning, Dependency scanning, SAST (static), DAST (dynamic), No scanning required

Question: Do artifacts require code signing or attestation?
Guidance: Signing: No signing, GPG signing, Sigstore/cosign, Certificate-based, Supply chain security (SLSA)

Question: What network segmentation is required for build infrastructure?
Guidance: Segmentation: Flat network, VLAN isolation, Firewall rules, DMZ for internet access, Zero-trust micro-segmentation

Question: Do you have data sovereignty or residency requirements for source code?
Guidance: Data residency: No restrictions, Country-specific (EU GDPR), Air-gapped domestic, Classified (no cloud)

Question: Where will the CI/CD infrastructure be deployed?
Guidance: Options: On-premises data center, Colocation facility, Edge location, Hybrid (on-prem + cloud burst)

Question: What power and cooling capacity is available for build servers?
Guidance: PowerEdge R650: 800W per server. Plan 6-8kW for 8-server build farm. Ensure adequate circuits and HVAC

Question: How much rack space is available for CI/CD infrastructure?
Guidance: Build agents: 8× PowerEdge R650 = 8U, Storage: Unity XT 380 = 3U, Network: Switches = 2U. Total ~15U required
Notes: Physical space and rack elevation planning

Question: How many DevOps engineers will manage CI/CD infrastructure?
Guidance: Team size: 1-2 engineers (small), 3-5 engineers (medium), 6+ engineers (enterprise)
Notes: Support team size and training requirements

Question: What is your team's experience with self-hosted CI/CD platforms?
Guidance: Experience: None (cloud-only), Basic (Jenkins/GitLab setup), Intermediate (pipeline optimization), Advanced (HA/DR)

Question: What is your team's experience with Linux server administration?
Guidance: Experience: None (Windows only), Basic (SSH, package mgmt), Intermediate (systemd, networking), Advanced (kernel, performance)

Question: What is your team's experience with Docker and container platforms?
Guidance: Experience: None, Basic (Dockerfile), Intermediate (Docker Compose), Advanced (Kubernetes, registry management)

Question: What uptime requirements do you have for CI/CD infrastructure?
Guidance: SLA: Best-effort 95% (downtime OK), Business 99% (maintenance windows), High 99.9% (HA required), Mission-critical 99.99%

Question: Do you need backup for build artifacts and CI/CD configuration?
Guidance: Backup: No backup (re-build), GitLab backup (config), Artifact backup (Veeam), Full DR with failover

Question: What monitoring and alerting is required for CI/CD infrastructure?
Guidance: Monitoring: Build queue depth, Agent utilization, Build success rate, Artifact download speed, System metrics (CPU, RAM, disk)

Question: What support coverage do you require from Dell?
Guidance: Options: Next business day (NBD), 4-hour response (ProSupport Plus), 2-hour mission-critical, 24x7 TAM

Question: What maintenance windows are acceptable for patching and updates?
Guidance: Change windows: Weekends only, Monthly window, Quarterly updates, Continuous deployment (zero-downtime)

Question: Who will be the technical lead for this CI/CD infrastructure project?
Guidance: Name, role, contact information (VP Engineering, DevOps Manager, Platform Lead)

Question: What internal resources are available for deployment and pipeline migration?
Guidance: List team members, roles, and time commitment (hours per week)
Notes: Resource planning and project timeline feasibility

Question: Do you need Dell ProDeploy services for server installation and configuration?
Guidance: ProDeploy: Rack installation, OS installation, GitLab setup, Pipeline migration assistance
Notes: Professional services and on-site support needs

Question: What pilot projects or teams will validate the on-prem CI/CD platform?
Guidance: Pilot selection: 5-10 microservice projects, Single team, Non-critical applications, Greenfield projects

Question: What is your preferred CI/CD migration strategy?
Guidance: Options: Pilot projects first, Phased by team (10 devs every 2 weeks), Parallel run (cloud + on-prem), All at once

Question: How many CI/CD pipelines need to be migrated?
Guidance: Pipeline count: <50 pipelines (small), 50-200 pipelines (medium), 200-500 pipelines (large), 500+ pipelines (enterprise)

Question: What training will be needed for developers and DevOps team?
Guidance: Types: GitLab CI/CD syntax, Artifactory usage, Pipeline debugging, Self-service onboarding, Admin training (GitLab/Artifactory)

Question: What documentation is required for CI/CD infrastructure handover?
Guidance: Deliverables: Architecture diagram, Pipeline templates, Runbooks, Troubleshooting guides, DR procedures

Question: What testing is required before production CI/CD cutover?
Guidance: Testing: Build performance benchmarks, Parallel build capacity, Artifact download speed, Deployment integration, DR failover

Question: What criteria must be met before CI/CD infrastructure is production-ready?
Guidance: Examples: Pilot validated (<5 min queue time), Team trained, Artifact repository operational, Cloud CI/CD decommissioned

Question: What are your concerns about migrating from cloud to on-premises CI/CD?
Guidance: Consider: Upfront CapEx, Infrastructure maintenance burden, Capacity planning, Scaling constraints, Vendor support quality
Notes: Primary implementation concerns and risk factors

Question: What happens if you need more build capacity than initially deployed?
Guidance: Options: Add PowerEdge servers incrementally, Cloud burst for peak demand, Queue builds, Developer wait time acceptable

Question: What is your tolerance for build infrastructure failures?
Guidance: Failed build agent: Queue builds to other agents. Failed GitLab: All builds blocked. Assess risk appetite and HA needs
Notes: Failure mode analysis and mitigation strategies

Question: What is your biggest concern about converting pipelines to new CI/CD platform?
Guidance: Common: Syntax differences (GitHub Actions → GitLab), Integration breakage, Performance regressions, Developer productivity impact

Question: What is your biggest concern about managing on-prem CI/CD infrastructure?
Guidance: Common: GitLab administration, Linux troubleshooting, Docker/container issues, Storage management, Network connectivity
Notes: Skill development and external support requirements

Question: How do you plan to avoid vendor lock-in with on-prem CI/CD?
Guidance: Strategies: Open standards (Docker, OCI), Pipeline portability, Multi-cloud runners, Avoid proprietary features

Question: What if on-prem CI/CD performance is slower than cloud baseline?
Guidance: Mitigation: Pilot validation before full migration, Benchmark testing, SLA-based acceptance, Hybrid cloud fallback option

Question: What constraints must the CI/CD solution work within?
Guidance: Consider: CapEx limits, OpEx annual budget, Software licensing costs, Approval processes, ROI payback period
Notes: Solution design boundaries and financial constraints

Question: What is your current monthly cloud CI/CD spend?
Guidance: Calculate: User licenses + runner minutes + artifact storage + egress. Example: GitHub Actions 50 users × $21 + $5K runners = $6K/month
Notes: ROI baseline for cost comparison analysis

Question: What cloud CI/CD platform costs are you incurring?
Guidance: Common: GitHub Actions (per-user + minutes), GitLab.com (per-user), CircleCI (containers), Azure DevOps (parallel jobs)

Question: What artifact storage and egress costs do you incur?
Guidance: Cloud costs: Artifact storage ($0.10/GB/month), Egress fees ($0.09/GB). Large repos incur significant egress charges
Notes: Hidden cloud costs that on-prem eliminates

Question: What ROI timeline and payback period are you targeting?
Guidance: On-prem CI/CD typically achieves ROI in 18-24 months vs cloud through cost avoidance and consistent performance

Question: Do you have preferences or constraints around CapEx vs OpEx spending?
Guidance: Consider: Dell Financial Services leasing (converts CapEx to OpEx), Budget approval processes, Cash flow constraints
